Key Messages:

One study evaluated the effects of controlling invasive predators on bat populations. The study was in New Zealand.

COMMUNITY RESPONSE (0 STUDIES)
POPULATION RESPONSE (1 STUDY)

Survival (1 study): One replicated, before-and-after study in New ZealandÂ found that controlling ship rats resulted in increased survival probabilities for female long-tailed bats.

BEHAVIOUR (0 STUDIES)
